Tell me about Aren Desai: [arendesai.com/portfolio] Aren Desai is a BS student in Computer Science & Data Science at UW-Madison, with expertise in programming, data science, computer graphics, and robotics.
What is Aren's academic background?: [arendesai.com/portfolio] Aren is pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Data Science at the University of Wisconsin-Madison, expected to graduate in Spring 2025.
What programming languages does Aren kno: **Programming Languages**: Aren is proficient in Python, SQL, R, Java, C/C++/C#, JavaScript, Julia, MATLAB, and more. [Explore his projects]([arendesai.com/portfolio) to see these languages in action.
Can you tell me about Aren's work experi: [arendesai.com/portfolio] Aren has interned at Madison Gas & Electric (Energy Supply Intern) and Compeer Financial (Data Analytics). He also holds leadership roles in Google Developer Student Club (Finance Lead) and Wisconsin Robotics (Arm Developer).
What data science projects has Aren work: [arendesai.com/datascience] Notable projects include the MarketSimOptimizer for MISO market simulation, LMP Forecasting using LEAR and DNN models, and a GCP-hosted website with an integrated LLM.
What graphics projects has Aren created?: [arendesai.com/computergraphics] Projects include a Blender/Unity 3D boat model, the Book of Joe web-based portfolio game, and a CyberCity 3D cyberpunk environment.
Does Aren have experience with robotics?: **Robotics Experience**: Yes, Aren contributed to the Wisconsin Rover Software project ([github.com/WisconsinRobotics/WRoverSoftware]) as part of his work at UW-Madison's robotics lab.
What coursework has Aren completed?: [arendesai.com/coursework] Aren has taken advanced courses in data science, computer graphics, and robotics at UW-Madison, including topics like machine learning and software development.
How can I see Aren's resume?: [arendesai.com/portfolio/resume.pdf] Download Aren's resume for details on his education, skills, projects, and experience. A more detailed version is available upon request.
What tools does Aren use for data scienc: **Data Science Tools**: Pandas, NumPy, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, Keras, and more. [Explore his work]([arendesai.com/datascience) to see these tools in action.
Can you tell me about Aren's leadership: [arendesai.com/portfolio] Aren serves as the Finance Lead for Google Developer Student Club and has contributed significantly to Wisconsin Robotics as an Arm Developer.
What is the MarketSimOptimizer?: **MarketSimOptimizer**: A project by Aren to simulate MISO electricity markets. [Learn more](http://arendesai.com/datascience) about its development and applications.
How does Aren use computer graphics?: **Computer Graphics Applications**: Aren uses Blender, Unity, and other tools for projects like the Book of Joe and CyberCity. [View his work]([arendesai.com/computergraphics).
What is LMP Forecasting?: **LMP Forecasting**: A project by Aren using LEAR and DNN models to predict Local Market Prices (LMPs) in energy markets. [Explore details](http://arendesai.com/datascience).
How does Aren contribute to robotics res: **Robotics Contributions**: Aren works on the Wisconsin Rover Software project, focusing on software development for robotic systems. [Learn more]([github.com/WisconsinRobotics/WRoverSoftware]).
What is the Book of Joe?: **Book of Joe**: A web-based portfolio game developed by Aren using computer graphics and interactive design. [Play it here](http://arendesai.com/computergraphics).
How can I contact Aren for collaboration: [arendesai.com/portfolio] Contact Aren through his portfolio website or via LinkedIn for potential collaborations in programming, data science, or robotics.
